programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 6987476, Title: Burden of Truth, --- Description: Burden of Truth: Created by Brad Simpson. With Kristin Kreuk, Peter Mooney, Meegwun Fairbrother, Anwen O'Driscoll. Big city lawyer Joanna Hanley returns to her hometown to take the case of a group of girls suffering from a mysterious illness." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt6987476/","name":"Burden of Truth","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWNiNTEyZmYtODIzMy00NmEzLTk4MmYtYTg4ZTc0MzJiOTRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjYzNDE4ODA@._V1_.jpg","description":"Big city lawyer Joanna Hanley returns to her hometown to take the case of a group of girls suffering from a mysterious illness.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6987476/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Bobonthecouch","dateCreated":"2018-10-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pretty good show but...","reviewBody":"The story lines are intriguing and the acting is pretty good. I want to give it a higher rating because at the end of each episode I've looked forward to the next one; However, the lack of logic and common sense (particularly in the earlier episodes) as well as continuity issues prevents me from doing so. The yo-yo effect of both main characters' commitment to the case, the unrealistic reactions by some of the characters in some instances and the confusing timeline references distract me from what would otherwise be a thoroughly enjoyable viewing experience. I have the season 1 finale to watch yet and I believe the show has been picked up for a second season so I will look forward to that. I hope some of the flaws will be addressed for series 2 but, I also hope the overall look and feel won't be drastically altered. Some shows in the past have been tweaked into nonexistence by network brass and viewer opinions. This first season seemed to be generally headed in the right direction. "Burden of Truth" could have a long run if handled properly.\n\nAddendum: The way I rate shows... I don't usually review anything less than a 7 because 6 would be a failing grade and I won't waste my time watching it. I'm old; I don't know how much time I've got left. Since I probably turned it off before getting even halfway through, it wouldn't be fair to rate or review it. 7 is watchable but I may go a while between episodes since, though somewhat entertaining, there are other shows more interesting or compelling. 8 would be a regular in my lineup. 9 is a must see and probably bingeable. 10 is just the epitome of superbity and headed for my all-time favorites list. I'm adding this to my reviews because it seems there are a lot of binary reactions to pretty much everything these days. I am not a like/unlike kind of guy. Big city lawyer Joanna Hanley returns to her hometown to take the case of a group of girls suffering from a mysterious illness." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt6987476/","name":"Burden of Truth","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWNiNTEyZmYtODIzMy00NmEzLTk4MmYtYTg4ZTc0MzJiOTRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjYzNDE4ODA@._V1_.jpg","description":"Big city lawyer Joanna Hanley returns to her hometown to take the case of a group of girls suffering from a mysterious illness.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6987476/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Bobonthecouch"},"dateCreated":"2018-10-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pretty good show but...","reviewBody":"The story lines are intriguing and the acting is pretty good. I want to give it a higher rating because at the end of each episode I've looked forward to the next one; However, the lack of logic and common sense (particularly in the earlier episodes) as well as continuity issues prevents me from doing so. The yo-yo effect of both main characters' commitment to the case, the unrealistic reactions by some of the characters in some instances and the confusing timeline references distract me from what would otherwise be a thoroughly enjoyable viewing experience. I have the season 1 finale to watch yet and I believe the show has been picked up for a second season so I will look forward to that. I hope some of the flaws will be addressed for series 2 but, I also hope the overall look and feel won't be drastically altered. Some shows in the past have been tweaked into nonexistence by network brass and viewer opinions. This first season seemed to be generally headed in the right direction. "Burden of Truth" could have a long run if handled properly.\n\nAddendum: The way I rate shows... I don't usually review anything less than a 7 because 6 would be a failing grade and I won't waste my time watching it. I'm old; I don't know how much time I've got left. Since I probably turned it off before getting even halfway through, it wouldn't be fair to rate or review it. 7 is watchable but I may go a while between episodes since, though somewhat entertaining, there are other shows more interesting or compelling. 8 would be a regular in my lineup. 9 is a must see and probably bingeable. 10 is just the epitome of superbity and headed for my all-time favorites list. I'm adding this to my reviews because it seems there are a lot of binary reactions to pretty much everything these days. I am not a like/unlike kind of guy. I see a lot of grays so if I give something a 10 it doesn't mean the only alternative is a 1.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3867,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-01-10","keywords":"legal drama,attorney,court case,legal system,female protagonist","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0471036/","name":"Kristin Kreuk"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1312105/","name":"Peter Mooney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2868495/","name":"Meegwun Fairbrother"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0121071/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0466443/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0051618/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0800920/","name":"Brad Simpson"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":""Off the Field" Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1975630617","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzc5NGViZWMtMzE0MS00MTI1LTg4YzAtNjdmYzcxMzFjYzE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzc5NGViZWMtMzE0MS00MTI1LTg4YzAtNjdmYzcxMzFjYzE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg","description":"When it's suspected that her big-pharma client's vaccine has caused a mysterious illness affecting a handful of teenaged girls, high-powered attorney Joanna Hanley (Kristin Kreuk) returns to her hometown of Millwood to quickly and quietly settle the case."}}</script><metacontent="

I want to give it a higher rating because at the end of each episode I've looked forward to the next one; However, the lack of logic and common sense (particularly in the earlier episodes) as well as continuity issues prevents me from doing so. The yo-yo effect of both main characters' commitment to the case, the unrealistic reactions by some of the characters in some instances and the confusing timeline references distract me from what would otherwise be a thoroughly enjoyable viewing experience. I have the season 1 finale to watch yet and I believe the show has been picked up for a second season so I will look forward to that. I hope some of the flaws will be addressed for series 2 but, I also hope the overall look and feel won't be drastically altered. Some shows in the past have been tweaked into nonexistence by network brass and viewer opinions. This first season seemed to be generally headed in the right direction. "Burden of Truth" could have a long run if handled properly.\n\nAddendum: The way I rate shows... I don't usually review anything less than a 7 because 6 would be a failing grade and I won't waste my time watching it. I'm old; I don't know how much time I've got left. Since I probably turned it off before getting even halfway through, it wouldn't be fair to rate or review it. 7 is watchable but I may go a while between episodes since, though somewhat entertaining, there are other shows more interesting or compelling. 8 would be a regular in my lineup. 9 is a must see and probably bingeable. 10 is just the epitome of superbity and headed for my all-time favorites list. I'm adding this to my reviews because it seems there are a lot of binary reactions to pretty much everything these days. I am not a like/unlike kind of guy. The cases of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service's Washington, D.C. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0364845/","name":"NCIS: Naval Criminal Investigative Service","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjVlMjZhYzYtOGQxNC00OTQxLTk2NzEtMWFmMmNhODA4YjYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjQ3MDgwNjY@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service's Washington, D.C. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0364845/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"shellemk"},"dateCreated":"2004-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Time flies when you're enjoying yourself","reviewBody":"and each episode speeds along all too quickly! I LOVE this show ! What is there NOT to like? Rich story lines, strongly portrayed (and very human) personalities you can really warm to who play off each other brilliantly, all with their own distinctive quirks and  above all  the always wonderful Mark Harmon as main character! What more could you ask for in a show?! There's not a single character I'd change  none that irritate  they're all excellent. I consider it a bonus that it's the one thing on TV that all our family equally enjoy for different reasons. Even my father-in-law likes this and we normally have totally different viewing preferences! I was delighted when I heard that there was a second series imminent. Only problem is that living in England, who knows how long after it's shown in the US we'll get to see it! Fortunately it's worth the wait!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":134442,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2003-09-23","keywords":"goth girl,babe scientist,special agent,naval criminal investigative service,police procedural","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001319/","name":"Mark Harmon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0564724/","name":"David McCallum"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0615266/","name":"Sean Murray"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0114905/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0066107/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0069074/","name":"Donald P. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0364845/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"shellemk","dateCreated":"2004-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Time flies when you're enjoying yourself","reviewBody":"and each episode speeds along all too quickly! I LOVE this show ! What is there NOT to like? Rich story lines, strongly portrayed (and very human) personalities you can really warm to who play off each other brilliantly, all with their own distinctive quirks and  above all  the always wonderful Mark Harmon as main character! What more could you ask for in a show?! There's not a single character I'd change  none that irritate  they're all excellent. I consider it a bonus that it's the one thing on TV that all our family equally enjoy for different reasons. Even my father-in-law likes this and we normally have totally different viewing preferences! I was delighted when I heard that there was a second series imminent. Only problem is that living in England, who knows how long after it's shown in the US we'll get to see it! programme.title: MacGyver
MacGyver
MacGyver
programme.desc:
MacGyver: Created by Lee David Zlotoff, Peter M. Lenkov, Paul Downs Colaizzo, Brett Mahoney. With Lucas Till, Tristin Mays, Justin Hires, Meredith Eaton. Young Angus "Mac" MacGyver works for a clandestine organization within the U.S. government, relying on his unconventional problem-solving skills to save lives." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1399045/","name":"MacGyver","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg1NzUzNmQtMWI2ZC00YzdlLWI5ZTgtMGM3MjJlZTgwYTVlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTIzMzY2NDQ2._V1_.jpg","description":"Young Angus "Mac" MacGyver works for a clandestine organization within the U.S. government, relying on his unconventional problem-solving skills to save lives.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1399045/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"nakrugt"},"dateCreated":"2021-10-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Just finished watching the show","reviewBody":"Currently watching Season 3 Episode 17, and I have not made up my mind yet.

First off, things I like:

On-screen titles: They are hilarious, to be honest. You should read them. Each and every one of them.

Characters: To be honest, MacGyver in this version is much more likeable. In the 1980s version, he was too arrogant to like. The team (just like the Team Flash) is nice to watch.

Self-awareness: The producers, the cast and the writers do not take themselves too seriously. So, it is fun to watch.

Things I do not like: the science, the convenient ingredients for everything, characters too fast to forgive others.

I will finish the series, though.

Edit: I finished the show.

I hope PrimeVideo or Netflix would pick up the show in the future for 10-episode seasons with a proper finale.

Also, I liked each and every cameo form the cast of LOST; Jin, Ethan, Naomi, the lady that got shot by Mikhail, and, of course, Hurley. I especially hoped that Hurley would say goodbye "see you in another life, brotha!" to Desmond, but he didn't.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":20051,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"2016-09-23","keywords":"character name as series title,surname as series title,one word series title,urban adventure,timeframe 2010s","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1395771/","name":"Lucas Till"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1159702/","name":"Tristin Mays"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2058713/","name":"Justin Hires"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0314692/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0504531/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0173285/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0957453/","name":"Lee David Zlotoff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0006997/","name":"Peter M. Lenkov"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2375463/","name":"Paul Downs Colaizzo"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"MacGyver Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1268233753","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjM4NTIwODExMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTE0NTIxMDI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjM4NTIwODExMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTE0NTIxMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":""}}</script><metacontent="

First off, things I like:

Edit: I finished the show.

I hope PrimeVideo or Netflix would pick up the show in the future for 10-episode seasons with a proper finale.

Also, I liked each and every cameo form the cast of LOST; Jin, Ethan, Naomi, the lady that got shot by Mikhail, and, of course, Hurley. IMDb data; ttnr: 1399045, Title: MacGyver, --- Description: MacGyver: Created by Lee David Zlotoff, Peter M. Lenkov, Paul Downs Colaizzo, Brett Mahoney. With Lucas Till, Tristin Mays, Justin Hires, Meredith Eaton. Young Angus "Mac" MacGyver works for a clandestine organization within the U.S. government, relying on his unconventional problem-solving skills to save lives." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1399045/","name":"MacGyver","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg1NzUzNmQtMWI2ZC00YzdlLWI5ZTgtMGM3MjJlZTgwYTVlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTIzMzY2NDQ2._V1_.jpg","description":"Young Angus "Mac" MacGyver works for a clandestine organization within the U.S. government, relying on his unconventional problem-solving skills to save lives.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1399045/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"nakrugt","dateCreated":"2021-10-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Just finished watching the show","reviewBody":"Currently watching Season 3 Episode 17, and I have not made up my mind yet.

First off, things I like:

On-screen titles: They are hilarious, to be honest. You should read them. Each and every one of them.

Characters: To be honest, MacGyver in this version is much more likeable. In the 1980s version, he was too arrogant to like. The team (just like the Team Flash) is nice to watch.

Self-awareness: The producers, the cast and the writers do not take themselves too seriously. So, it is fun to watch.

Things I do not like: the science, the convenient ingredients for everything, characters too fast to forgive others.

I will finish the series, though.

Edit: I finished the show.

I hope PrimeVideo or Netflix would pick up the show in the future for 10-episode seasons with a proper finale.

Also, I liked each and every cameo form the cast of LOST; Jin, Ethan, Naomi, the lady that got shot by Mikhail, and, of course, Hurley. I especially hoped that Hurley would say goodbye "see you in another life, brotha!" to Desmond, but he didn't.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":20051,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"2016-09-23","keywords":"character name as series title,surname as series title,one word series title,urban adventure,timeframe 2010s","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1395771/","name":"Lucas Till","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1159702/","name":"Tristin Mays","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2058713/","name":"Justin Hires"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0314692/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0504531/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0173285/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0957453/","name":"Lee David Zlotoff","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0006997/","name":"Peter M. First off, things I like:

On-screen titles: They are hilarious, to be honest. You should read them. Each and every one of them.

Characters: To be honest, MacGyver in this version is much more likeable. In the 1980s version, he was too arrogant to like. The team (just like the Team Flash) is nice to watch.

Self-awareness: The producers, the cast and the writers do not take themselves too seriously. So, it is fun to watch.

Things I do not like: the science, the convenient ingredients for everything, characters too fast to forgive others.

I will finish the series, though.

Edit: I finished the show.

I hope PrimeVideo or Netflix would pick up the show in the future for 10-episode seasons with a proper finale.

Also, I liked each and every cameo form the cast of LOST; Jin, Ethan, Naomi, the lady that got shot by Mikhail, and, of course, Hurley. I especially hoped that Hurley would say goodbye "see you in another life, brotha!" to Desmond, but he didn't.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":20051,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"2016-09-23","keywords":"character name as series title,surname as series title,one word series title,urban adventure,timeframe 2010s","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1395771/","name":"Lucas Till","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1159702/","name":"Tristin Mays","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2058713/","name":"Justin Hires"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0314692/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0504531/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0173285/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0957453/","name":"Lee David Zlotoff","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0006997/","name":"Peter M. programme.title: Flatliners
Linia życia
Flatliners
programme.desc: Flatliners: Directed by Niels Arden Oplev. With Elliot Page, Diego Luna, Nina Dobrev, James Norton. Five medical students, obsessed by what lies beyond the confines of life, embark on a daring experiment: by stopping their hearts for short periods, each triggers a near-death experience - giving them a firsthand account of the afterlife." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2039338/","name":"Flatliners","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTExMTk2ODk0NDNeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDMxNTExNjIy._V1_.jpg","description":"Five medical students, obsessed by what lies beyond the confines of life, embark on a daring experiment: by stopping their hearts for short periods, each triggers a near-death experience - giving them a firsthand account of the after","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2039338/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ggallegosgroupuk"},"dateCreated":"2017-09-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"What Ever Happened To Original Ideas?","reviewBody":"It's just depressing for a movie lover like me to see a film like Joel Schumacher's 1990 Flatliners remade. Why? Can anyone come out with something we haven't seen before or at least from a fresh new POV. Somebody told me that my reaction is "generational" - I fear that's true. It makes me feel really old. I almost walked out of Mother!, the other day - something I've never done - because I felt treated like a moron. To steal from Robert Polanski to do what, what? Here is even worse. They're stealing from Joel Schumacher without having any of the...what was it that the 1990 had that this one hasn't? Well let's say that the first one wasn't a remake. Where are the mavericks? The new ones. The ones I love are in their 70's or gone. I do apologize I'm just venting my frustration. Thank you for indulging me.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":2}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":45633,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2017-09-29","keywords":"medical student,near death experience,medical experiment,flashback,remake","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi537508121","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE1NjExOTcwNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjY5Mjc0MzI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE1NjExOTcwNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjY5Mjc0MzI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Five medical students who are obsessed by what lies beyond the confines of life embark on a daring experiment: by stopping their hearts for short periods, each triggers a near-death experience - giving them a firsthand account of the afterlife."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0680983/","name":"Elliot Page"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0526019/","name":"Diego Luna"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2400045/","name":"Nina Dobrev"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0649117/","name":"Niels Arden Oplev"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0285648/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002647/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0276823/","name":"Peter Filardi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1618286/","name":"Ben Ripley"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Rock the Kasbah
Rock the Kasbah
programme.desc: Rock the Kasbah: Directed by Barry Levinson. With Bill Murray, Bruce Willis, Kate Hudson, Zooey Deschanel. A down-on-his-luck music manager discovers a teenage girl with an extraordinary voice while on a music tour in Afghanistan and takes her to Kabul to compete on the popular television show, Afghan Star." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3164256/","name":"Rock the Kasbah","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU1OTY5MjIyM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTIwMDYyMjI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A down-on-his-luck music manager discovers a teenage girl with an extraordinary voice while on a music tour in Afghanistan and takes her to Kabul to compete on the popular television show, Afghan Star.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3164256/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dalegribz"},"dateCreated":"2015-10-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"If you love Bill and music ignore the hate(ALSO STAR WARS TRAILER)","reviewBody":"First of I love Bill Murray in just about anything. I often check up on Bill to see what he is taking on next and have looked forward to this ever since i read about it. I enjoy going to the movies with my grandmother for a nice time together and asked her out to spend 2 hours with Bill today. I was not disappointed what so ever. Yes there was more potential with the stellar cast that was put together and the editing may be a bit sloppy but don't let that turn you off. This movie will take you on a journey if you care to let it. Murray once again plays a bitter old timer that turns out to have a heart of gold in the end. If you are sick of this shtick, which i will never get tired of, then don't bother. But this is a social commentary on the oppression of middle eastern women and really the overall need to take a stand for yourself. Bill has the "golden ears" and knows talent when he hears it even if he didn't discover it himself. He puts his life on the line for his 20% to support an Afghani girl(one in too many) with a talent she isn't allowed to share. Once this comes into play the movie blossoms into beauty. While it isn't lol funny, which i don't understand why people come to expect that from William these days, it is very sweet and heartfelt. The jokes are there if you care to listen and not sit on a pedestal. I get if you don't want to be ripped off for the price of admission for this movie but don't s**t on it and wait to rent it. It is still far better than 99% of the garbage that comes out on a weekly basis. I also enjoy casually questioning people as we leave the theater as to how they enjoyed the film and ran into a refugee from Afghanistan who really enjoyed this picture and the message that it sent. Idk I'm half drunk and rambling and wrote a terrible first review but Eff off film snobs go judge the globes and shove them where the sun don't shine :) peace out imdbers","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":11835,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Music","War"],"datePublished":"2015-10-23","keywords":"bad luck,watching tv,women's rights,21st century,united states of america","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2184688409","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUxMDA3OTkyM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTE3NDc2NjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUxMDA3OTkyM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTE3NDc2NjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A down-on-his-luck music manager discovers a teenage girl with an extraordinary voice while on a music tour in Afghanistan and takes her to Kabul to compete on the popular television show, Afghan Star."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000195/","name":"Bill Murray"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5647588/","name":"Leem Lubany"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0221046/","name":"Zooey Deschanel"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001469/","name":"Barry Levinson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0551691/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0088656/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003687/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0322248/","name":"Mitch Glazer"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

Shaun Murphy, a young surgeon with autism and Savant syndrome, is recruited into the surgical unit of a prestigious hospital." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt6470478/","name":"The Good Doctor","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTViMDJlYzEtOTUxNi00ZTU5LWI5MTYtMGViNTQ4NTVkYTMyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzAzNTY3MDM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Shaun Murphy, a young surgeon with autism and Savant syndrome, is recruited into the surgical unit of a prestigious hospital.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6470478/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"babyk-44846"},"dateCreated":"2017-11-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Absolutely Amazed with this show","reviewBody":"I, for one.... can not Believe the reviews I have read. It is totally unfathomable that people have such narrow minds. First off. It is a television show. Nothing more People! It is a refreshing insight to all that autistic children, adults face on a daily basis. It is thoughts of what is possible for ANYONE with any type of disability they may face to have a positive outlook for what they stand for and fight for at any given time in their life. Although, it is extreme... It is the possibility that something greater can happen in the life of someone with disabilities no matter how great or small. I find a learning experience in every episode I have watched and that is to learn more about autism from every aspect and have compassion enough to care ... as a human being. I would be very sad if this show doesn't continue and show it's full potential. I will be forever watching as long as it is aired!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":83102,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2017-09-25","keywords":"autism,surgeon,based on tv series,three word series title,san francisco california","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0383603/","name":"Freddie Highmore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004991/","name":"Hill Harper"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0771493/","name":"Richard Schiff"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0483675/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0209226/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0466990/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0794914/","name":"David Shore"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 5 Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2327495449","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzYyY2ZkNWMtOTRjZS00OGQ4LWE1OTUtNzVjODM1YWY5NGRiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzYyY2ZkNWMtOTRjZS00OGQ4LWE1OTUtNzVjODM1YWY5NGRiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"With new beginnings come new challenges. programme.title: Night Hunter
Nocny łowca
Nomis
programme.desc:
Night Hunter: Directed by David Raymond. With Henry Cavill, Ben Kingsley, Alexandra Daddario, Stanley Tucci. A weathered Lieutenant, his police force, and a local vigilante are all caught up in a dangerous scheme involving a recently arrested, troubled man who's linked to years of female abductions and murders." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6533240/","name":"Night Hunter","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWRhZTI3YzMtYjVmMi00ZDMyLWE1MGQtMWI0OTU5MzJmNmU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A weathered Lieutenant, his police force, and a local vigilante are all caught up in a dangerous scheme involving a recently arrested, troubled man who's linked to years of female abductions and murders.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6533240/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Top_Dawg_Critic"},"dateCreated":"2019-08-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Such a shame for a missed golden opportunity","reviewBody":"This story (premise) had such opportunity to be a great film, but I guess the budget went more towards the top-billed cast, than in the production.

I certainly give credit to new filmmakers for taking the leap, and often don't critique them as hard due to their lack of experience. But newbie writer, director and producer David Raymond should've maybe had one lesser top-lead and invested in a seasoned screenwriter and editor - of where this film failed drastically in a missed golden opportunity.

The screenplay had major plot and technical issues, that could've been easily avoided, or edited properly. Then the editing in general was atrocious. A few scenes popped in and out within seconds and made no sense. The music/score was so overbearing it was annoying, and in some scenes louder than the dialogue. Raymond's lack of directing experience was evident in the poor shaky-cam shots, as it was in his failure to direct his sub-cast properly (the seasoned pros clearly handled their own). Brendan Fletcher was perfectly cast and great playing the character of Simon. But casting Henry Cavill was a huge mistake. His acting was stale and unconvincing, as well as annoying with his monotonic dialogue and poorly executed macho demeanor.

Nevertheless, for a newbie writer and director (this film being his 2nd/3rd resume entry as a filmmaker), it was surprisingly decent all things considered. Too bad it could've been great with proper editing and screenplay review. programme.review: --- Actors: Henry Cavill (role=Marshall), Ben Kingsley (role=Cooper), Alexandra Daddario (role=Rachel), Stanley Tucci (role=Commissioner Harper), Brendan Fletcher (role=Simon), Minka Kelly (role=Angie), Nathan Fillion (role=Quinn), Mpho Koaho (role=Glasgow), Emma Tremblay (role=Faye), Eliana Jones (role=Lara), Daniela Lavender (role=Dickerman), Jason Tremblay (role=Robert)

IMDb data; ttnr: 6533240, Title: Night Hunter, --- Description: Night Hunter: Directed by David Raymond. With Henry Cavill, Ben Kingsley, Alexandra Daddario, Stanley Tucci. A weathered Lieutenant, his police force, and a local vigilante are all caught up in a dangerous scheme involving a recently arrested, troubled man who's linked to years of female abductions and murders." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6533240/","name":"Night Hunter","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWRhZTI3YzMtYjVmMi00ZDMyLWE1MGQtMWI0OTU5MzJmNmU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A weathered Lieutenant, his police force, and a local vigilante are all caught up in a dangerous scheme involving a recently arrested, troubled man who's linked to years of female abductions and murders.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6533240/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Top_Dawg_Critic","dateCreated":"2019-08-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Such a shame for a missed golden opportunity","reviewBody":"This story (premise) had such opportunity to be a great film, but I guess the budget went more towards the top-billed cast, than in the production.

I certainly give credit to new filmmakers for taking the leap, and often don't critique them as hard due to their lack of experience. But newbie writer, director and producer David Raymond should've maybe had one lesser top-lead and invested in a seasoned screenwriter and editor - of where this film failed drastically in a missed golden opportunity.

The screenplay had major plot and technical issues, that could've been easily avoided, or edited properly. Then the editing in general was atrocious. A few scenes popped in and out within seconds and made no sense. The music/score was so overbearing it was annoying, and in some scenes louder than the dialogue. Raymond's lack of directing experience was evident in the poor shaky-cam shots, as it was in his failure to direct his sub-cast properly (the seasoned pros clearly handled their own). Brendan Fletcher was perfectly cast and great playing the character of Simon. But casting Henry Cavill was a huge mistake. His acting was stale and unconvincing, as well as annoying with his monotonic dialogue and poorly executed macho demeanor.

Nevertheless, for a newbie writer and director (this film being his 2nd/3rd resume entry as a filmmaker), it was surprisingly decent all things considered. Too bad it could've been great with proper editing and screenplay review. Still, a solid and well deserving 7/10 from me.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":19137,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime"],"datePublished":"2019-08-08","keywords":"revenge,kidnapping,escape,twins,twin","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Night Hunter","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2931277593","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDU5NTc3OTUtNjE5ZS00MGNhLWI3MGUtMDM0ZDE4ZmNmMDgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDU5NTc3OTUtNjE5ZS00MGNhLWI3MGUtMDM0ZDE4ZmNmMDgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0147147/","name":"Henry Cavill","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001426/","name":"Ben Kingsley","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1275259/","name":"Alexandra Daddario"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2006019/","name":"David Raymond"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0630228/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0298559/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009056/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2006019/","name":"David Raymond"],"duration":"PT1H38M"</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Harrow: Created by Stephen M. Irwin, Leigh McGrath. With Ioan Gruffudd, Darren Gilshenan, Damien Garvey, Ella Newton. Harrow tells the story of Dr. Daniel Harrow, a forensic pathologist with a total disregard for authority." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt7242816/","name":"Harrow","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY2MzczNjMwM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDcxMTE4NDM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Harrow tells the story of Dr. Daniel Harrow, a forensic pathologist with a total disregard for authority.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7242816/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"oliviamteller"},"dateCreated":"2018-03-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"More please.","reviewBody":"While I can't speak to the authenticity of Australian location portrayal, as other reviewers have, I think the show was great. Acting, camera work, jokes, and banter between coworkers, all served to create a believable environment. And that dark past of his, just waiting to be revealed and possibly destroy everything, hovers in the background, creating tension. I find myself waiting for the next episode. One reviewer complains about there being a personal story behind the main character, but that's how we end up finding out about that mysterious past of his. And, seriously, what do they want? A cardboard cutout character with minimal lines and no home life? The added drama keeps the show interesting, adds extra levels to the character as it goes, and family members are always potentially at risk when there's a hero character involved, so there's that. Give the show a chance and don't pay attention to bad reviews if you already think you might like something.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7057,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2018-03-09","keywords":"doctor,caucasian,latex gloves,forensic pathologist,dead body","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0344435/","name":"Ioan Gruffudd"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0319696/","name":"Darren Gilshenan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0960946/","name":"Damien Garvey"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0110425/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2207641/","name":"Stephen M. Irwin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0569838/","name":"Leigh McGrath"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Harrow","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi709605401","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGU2NjZmNjEtMTY1Ni00YjY5LTgwNzItMzNlMDU0YjFlNWEwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGU2NjZmNjEtMTY1Ni00YjY5LTgwNzItMzNlMDU0YjFlNWEwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Ioan Gruffudd stars as Daniel Harrow, a brilliant forensic pathologist who solves the cases others can't. #HarrowABC"}}</script><metacontent="

Harrow tells the story of Dr. Daniel Harrow, a forensic pathologist with a total disregard for authority." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt7242816/","name":"Harrow","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY2MzczNjMwM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDcxMTE4NDM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Harrow tells the story of Dr. Daniel Harrow, a forensic pathologist with a total disregard for authority.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7242816/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"oliviamteller","dateCreated":"2018-03-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"More please.","reviewBody":"While I can't speak to the authenticity of Australian location portrayal, as other reviewers have, I think the show was great. Acting, camera work, jokes, and banter between coworkers, all served to create a believable environment. And that dark past of his, just waiting to be revealed and possibly destroy everything, hovers in the background, creating tension. I find myself waiting for the next episode. One reviewer complains about there being a personal story behind the main character, but that's how we end up finding out about that mysterious past of his. And, seriously, what do they want? A cardboard cutout character with minimal lines and no home life? The added drama keeps the show interesting, adds extra levels to the character as it goes, and family members are always potentially at risk when there's a hero character involved, so there's that. programme.title: Candice Renoir
Candice Renoir
Candice Renoir
programme.desc: Candice Renoir: Created by Robin Barataud, Brigitte Peskine, Solen Roy-Pagenault. With Cécile Bois, Raphaël Lenglet, Clara Antoons, Ali Marhyar. The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Her daily routine is between solving crimes, taking out fights with her much younger female police superior officer, getting her kids to school - in addition - handling their problems too and keeping her team in line. It's a very funny and witty series with a lot of french charm and intelligent story writing. Not another dull crime series all over again. It's like a fresh french breeze on the TV screen. Candice is like a female Columbo version in high heels, handbag pink scarf and a 9mm in her holster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2819924/","name":"Candice Renoir","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM3YzUxM2UtZjIyMC00Zjg5LTk0NTMtNGQ3ZWQ0ODhlMTJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc0NTExNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0364845/","name":"NCIS: Naval Criminal Investigative Service","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjVlMjZhYzYtOGQxNC00OTQxLTk2NzEtMWFmMmNhODA4YjYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjQ3MDgwNjY@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service's Washington, D.C. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0364845/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"shellemk"},"dateCreated":"2004-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Time flies when you're enjoying yourself","reviewBody":"and each episode speeds along all too quickly! I LOVE this show ! What is there NOT to like? Rich story lines, strongly portrayed (and very human) personalities you can really warm to who play off each other brilliantly, all with their own distinctive quirks and  above all  the always wonderful Mark Harmon as main character! What more could you ask for in a show?! There's not a single character I'd change  none that irritate  they're all excellent. I consider it a bonus that it's the one thing on TV that all our family equally enjoy for different reasons. Even my father-in-law likes this and we normally have totally different viewing preferences! I was delighted when I heard that there was a second series imminent. Only problem is that living in England, who knows how long after it's shown in the US we'll get to see it! Fortunately it's worth the wait!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":134442,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2003-09-23","keywords":"goth girl,babe scientist,special agent,naval criminal investigative service,police procedural","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001319/","name":"Mark Harmon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0564724/","name":"David McCallum"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0615266/","name":"Sean Murray"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0114905/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0066107/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0069074/","name":"Donald P. programme.title: Candice Renoir
Candice Renoir
Candice Renoir
programme.desc: Candice Renoir: Created by Robin Barataud, Brigitte Peskine, Solen Roy-Pagenault. With Cécile Bois, Raphaël Lenglet, Clara Antoons, Ali Marhyar. The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Her daily routine is between solving crimes, taking out fights with her much younger female police superior officer, getting her kids to school - in addition - handling their problems too and keeping her team in line. It's a very funny and witty series with a lot of french charm and intelligent story writing. Not another dull crime series all over again. It's like a fresh french breeze on the TV screen. Candice is like a female Columbo version in high heels, handbag pink scarf and a 9mm in her holster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2819924/","name":"Candice Renoir","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM3YzUxM2UtZjIyMC00Zjg5LTk0NTMtNGQ3ZWQ0ODhlMTJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc0NTExNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Harrow tells the story of Dr. Daniel Harrow, a forensic pathologist with a total disregard for authority." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt7242816/","name":"Harrow","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY2MzczNjMwM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDcxMTE4NDM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Harrow tells the story of Dr. Daniel Harrow, a forensic pathologist with a total disregard for authority.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7242816/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"oliviamteller"},"dateCreated":"2018-03-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"More please.","reviewBody":"While I can't speak to the authenticity of Australian location portrayal, as other reviewers have, I think the show was great. Acting, camera work, jokes, and banter between coworkers, all served to create a believable environment. And that dark past of his, just waiting to be revealed and possibly destroy everything, hovers in the background, creating tension. I find myself waiting for the next episode. One reviewer complains about there being a personal story behind the main character, but that's how we end up finding out about that mysterious past of his. And, seriously, what do they want? A cardboard cutout character with minimal lines and no home life? The added drama keeps the show interesting, adds extra levels to the character as it goes, and family members are always potentially at risk when there's a hero character involved, so there's that. Give the show a chance and don't pay attention to bad reviews if you already think you might like something.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7057,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2018-03-09","keywords":"doctor,caucasian,latex gloves,forensic pathologist,dead body","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0344435/","name":"Ioan Gruffudd"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0319696/","name":"Darren Gilshenan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0960946/","name":"Damien Garvey"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0110425/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2207641/","name":"Stephen M. programme.desc: Profilage: Created by Fanny Robert, Sophie Lebarbier. With Jean-Michel Martial, Raphaël Ferret, Philippe Bas, Valérie Dashwood. Chloé Saint-Laurent is a profiler and works with a police team to solve murders in Paris. She's very sweet, she wears very colored clothes and a huge yellow bag. She looks like a little girl who needs a doll, but she's very smart and a very good profiler. Step by step, she fits in the team and her colleagues, very reserved at first, become her best friends." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1418572/","name":"Profilage","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWY0ZmE1ZWQtNjEzNy00YWE0LTkzOTgtNjc3MjQ2NWQ4YzYxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTI2OTA2NTEw._V1_.jpg","description":"Chloé Saint-Laurent is a profiler and works with a police team to solve murders in Paris. With Jean-Michel Martial, Raphaël Ferret, Philippe Bas, Valérie Dashwood. Chloé Saint-Laurent is a profiler and works with a police team to solve murders in Paris. She's very sweet, she wears very colored clothes and a huge yellow bag. She looks like a little girl who needs a doll, but she's very smart and a very good profiler. programme.desc: Harrow: Created by Stephen M. Irwin, Leigh McGrath. With Ioan Gruffudd, Darren Gilshenan, Damien Garvey, Ella Newton. Harrow tells the story of Dr. Daniel Harrow, a forensic pathologist with a total disregard for authority." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt7242816/","name":"Harrow","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY2MzczNjMwM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDcxMTE4NDM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Harrow tells the story of Dr. Daniel Harrow, a forensic pathologist with a total disregard for authority.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7242816/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"oliviamteller"},"dateCreated":"2018-03-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"More please.","reviewBody":"While I can't speak to the authenticity of Australian location portrayal, as other reviewers have, I think the show was great. Acting, camera work, jokes, and banter between coworkers, all served to create a believable environment. And that dark past of his, just waiting to be revealed and possibly destroy everything, hovers in the background, creating tension. I find myself waiting for the next episode. One reviewer complains about there being a personal story behind the main character, but that's how we end up finding out about that mysterious past of his. And, seriously, what do they want? A cardboard cutout character with minimal lines and no home life? The added drama keeps the show interesting, adds extra levels to the character as it goes, and family members are always potentially at risk when there's a hero character involved, so there's that. Give the show a chance and don't pay attention to bad reviews if you already think you might like something.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7057,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2018-03-09","keywords":"doctor,caucasian,latex gloves,forensic pathologist,dead body","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0344435/","name":"Ioan Gruffudd"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0319696/","name":"Darren Gilshenan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0960946/","name":"Damien Garvey"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0110425/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2207641/","name":"Stephen M. Irwin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0569838/","name":"Leigh McGrath"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Harrow","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi709605401","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGU2NjZmNjEtMTY1Ni00YjY5LTgwNzItMzNlMDU0YjFlNWEwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGU2NjZmNjEtMTY1Ni00YjY5LTgwNzItMzNlMDU0YjFlNWEwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Ioan Gruffudd stars as Daniel Harrow, a brilliant forensic pathologist who solves the cases others can't. #HarrowABC"}}</script><metacontent="

Harrow tells the story of Dr. Daniel Harrow, a forensic pathologist with a total disregard for authority." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt7242816/","name":"Harrow","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY2MzczNjMwM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDcxMTE4NDM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Harrow tells the story of Dr. Daniel Harrow, a forensic pathologist with a total disregard for authority.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7242816/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"oliviamteller","dateCreated":"2018-03-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"More please.","reviewBody":"While I can't speak to the authenticity of Australian location portrayal, as other reviewers have, I think the show was great. Acting, camera work, jokes, and banter between coworkers, all served to create a believable environment. And that dark past of his, just waiting to be revealed and possibly destroy everything, hovers in the background, creating tension. I find myself waiting for the next episode. One reviewer complains about there being a personal story behind the main character, but that's how we end up finding out about that mysterious past of his. And, seriously, what do they want? A cardboard cutout character with minimal lines and no home life? The added drama keeps the show interesting, adds extra levels to the character as it goes, and family members are always potentially at risk when there's a hero character involved, so there's that. programme.title: Candice Renoir
Candice Renoir
Candice Renoir
programme.desc: Candice Renoir: Created by Robin Barataud, Brigitte Peskine, Solen Roy-Pagenault. With Cécile Bois, Raphaël Lenglet, Clara Antoons, Ali Marhyar. The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Her daily routine is between solving crimes, taking out fights with her much younger female police superior officer, getting her kids to school - in addition - handling their problems too and keeping her team in line. It's a very funny and witty series with a lot of french charm and intelligent story writing. Not another dull crime series all over again. It's like a fresh french breeze on the TV screen. Candice is like a female Columbo version in high heels, handbag pink scarf and a 9mm in her holster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2819924/","name":"Candice Renoir","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM3YzUxM2UtZjIyMC00Zjg5LTk0NTMtNGQ3ZWQ0ODhlMTJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc0NTExNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0364845/","name":"NCIS: Naval Criminal Investigative Service","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjVlMjZhYzYtOGQxNC00OTQxLTk2NzEtMWFmMmNhODA4YjYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjQ3MDgwNjY@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service's Washington, D.C. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0364845/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"shellemk"},"dateCreated":"2004-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Time flies when you're enjoying yourself","reviewBody":"and each episode speeds along all too quickly! I LOVE this show ! What is there NOT to like? Rich story lines, strongly portrayed (and very human) personalities you can really warm to who play off each other brilliantly, all with their own distinctive quirks and  above all  the always wonderful Mark Harmon as main character! What more could you ask for in a show?! There's not a single character I'd change  none that irritate  they're all excellent. I consider it a bonus that it's the one thing on TV that all our family equally enjoy for different reasons. Even my father-in-law likes this and we normally have totally different viewing preferences! I was delighted when I heard that there was a second series imminent. Only problem is that living in England, who knows how long after it's shown in the US we'll get to see it! Fortunately it's worth the wait!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":134442,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2003-09-23","keywords":"goth girl,babe scientist,special agent,naval criminal investigative service,police procedural","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001319/","name":"Mark Harmon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0564724/","name":"David McCallum"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0615266/","name":"Sean Murray"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0114905/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0066107/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0069074/","name":"Donald P. I LOVE this show ! What is there NOT to like? Rich story lines, strongly portrayed (and very human) personalities you can really warm to who play off each other brilliantly, all with their own distinctive quirks and  above all  the always wonderful Mark Harmon as main character! I consider it a bonus that it's the one thing on TV that all our family equally enjoy for different reasons. programme.title: Candice Renoir
Candice Renoir
Candice Renoir
programme.desc: Candice Renoir: Created by Robin Barataud, Brigitte Peskine, Solen Roy-Pagenault. With Cécile Bois, Raphaël Lenglet, Clara Antoons, Ali Marhyar. The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Her daily routine is between solving crimes, taking out fights with her much younger female police superior officer, getting her kids to school - in addition - handling their problems too and keeping her team in line. It's a very funny and witty series with a lot of french charm and intelligent story writing. Not another dull crime series all over again. It's like a fresh french breeze on the TV screen. Candice is like a female Columbo version in high heels, handbag pink scarf and a 9mm in her holster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2819924/","name":"Candice Renoir","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM3YzUxM2UtZjIyMC00Zjg5LTk0NTMtNGQ3ZWQ0ODhlMTJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc0NTExNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. programme.desc: Candice Renoir: Created by Robin Barataud, Brigitte Peskine, Solen Roy-Pagenault. With Cécile Bois, Raphaël Lenglet, Clara Antoons, Ali Marhyar. The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Her daily routine is between solving crimes, taking out fights with her much younger female police superior officer, getting her kids to school - in addition - handling their problems too and keeping her team in line. It's a very funny and witty series with a lot of french charm and intelligent story writing. Not another dull crime series all over again. It's like a fresh french breeze on the TV screen. Patolog
Harrow
programme.desc: Harrow: Created by Stephen M. Irwin, Leigh McGrath. With Ioan Gruffudd, Darren Gilshenan, Damien Garvey, Ella Newton. Harrow tells the story of Dr. Daniel Harrow, a forensic pathologist with a total disregard for authority." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt7242816/","name":"Harrow","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY2MzczNjMwM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDcxMTE4NDM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Harrow tells the story of Dr. Daniel Harrow, a forensic pathologist with a total disregard for authority.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7242816/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"oliviamteller"},"dateCreated":"2018-03-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"More please.","reviewBody":"While I can't speak to the authenticity of Australian location portrayal, as other reviewers have, I think the show was great. Acting, camera work, jokes, and banter between coworkers, all served to create a believable environment. And that dark past of his, just waiting to be revealed and possibly destroy everything, hovers in the background, creating tension. I find myself waiting for the next episode. One reviewer complains about there being a personal story behind the main character, but that's how we end up finding out about that mysterious past of his. And, seriously, what do they want? A cardboard cutout character with minimal lines and no home life? The added drama keeps the show interesting, adds extra levels to the character as it goes, and family members are always potentially at risk when there's a hero character involved, so there's that. Give the show a chance and don't pay attention to bad reviews if you already think you might like something.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7057,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2018-03-09","keywords":"doctor,caucasian,latex gloves,forensic pathologist,dead body","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0344435/","name":"Ioan Gruffudd"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0319696/","name":"Darren Gilshenan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0960946/","name":"Damien Garvey"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0110425/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2207641/","name":"Stephen M. Irwin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0569838/","name":"Leigh McGrath"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Harrow","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi709605401","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGU2NjZmNjEtMTY1Ni00YjY5LTgwNzItMzNlMDU0YjFlNWEwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGU2NjZmNjEtMTY1Ni00YjY5LTgwNzItMzNlMDU0YjFlNWEwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Ioan Gruffudd stars as Daniel Harrow, a brilliant forensic pathologist who solves the cases others can't. #HarrowABC"}}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Profilage: Created by Fanny Robert, Sophie Lebarbier. With Jean-Michel Martial, Raphaël Ferret, Philippe Bas, Valérie Dashwood. Chloé Saint-Laurent is a profiler and works with a police team to solve murders in Paris. She's very sweet, she wears very colored clothes and a huge yellow bag. She looks like a little girl who needs a doll, but she's very smart and a very good profiler. Follows the lives and cases of a dirty Los Angeles Police Department cop and the unit under his command." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0286486/","name":"The Shield","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTcwNzQwODI5NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzQxMjI5MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows the lives and cases of a dirty Los Angeles Police Department cop and the unit under his command.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0286486/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"danielcereto"},"dateCreated":"2020-07-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Shield on 2020","reviewBody":"I just finished this series today on July 2020 and all I have to say is that it does not look cheap, old or non interesting, just keeping in mind this was filmed between 2002-2008. First, most of the main cast are extremely good actors. Vic, Aceveda and Shane were the most powerful. Second, the storyline and the length of the chapters are quite good too. Probably the story could have been told with 4-5 seasons easily. But it is what it is. Last, camera work, make up and sound are pretty cool. I can't believe this show started on 2002. On the other hand, seems some characters were not fully developed or look like the writers didn't want to give them credit. But not a big thing. So, overall if you're looking for an excellent cops show, brutal, raw and almost perfect, this one is for you. Now, I'm going to watch The Wire. programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 0286486, Title: The Shield, --- Description: The Shield: Created by Shawn Ryan. With Michael Chiklis, Michael Jace, Jay Karnes, CCH Pounder. Follows the lives and cases of a dirty Los Angeles Police Department cop and the unit under his command." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0286486/","name":"The Shield","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTcwNzQwODI5NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzQxMjI5MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows the lives and cases of a dirty Los Angeles Police Department cop and the unit under his command.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0286486/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"danielcereto","dateCreated":"2020-07-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Shield on 2020","reviewBody":"I just finished this series today on July 2020 and all I have to say is that it does not look cheap, old or non interesting, just keeping in mind this was filmed between 2002-2008. First, most of the main cast are extremely good actors. Vic, Aceveda and Shane were the most powerful. Second, the storyline and the length of the chapters are quite good too. Probably the story could have been told with 4-5 seasons easily. But it is what it is. Last, camera work, make up and sound are pretty cool. I can't believe this show started on 2002. On the other hand, seems some characters were not fully developed or look like the writers didn't want to give them credit. But not a big thing. So, overall if you're looking for an excellent cops show, brutal, raw and almost perfect, this one is for you. Now, I'm going to watch The Wire. I want to compare both shows and see which one is better.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":77198,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.7,"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2002-03-12","keywords":"corrupt cop,los angeles california,made for cable tv,mayor,drugs","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004821/","name":"Michael Chiklis","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0413052/","name":"Michael Jace","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0439813/","name":"Jay Karnes"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0086397/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0203234/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056447/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0752841/","name":"Shawn Ryan"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Shield: Season Seven","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi425591577","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI1NjYxNjgtYmIzYy00ZmUzLTllNjMtMzA3MDMwMDAxZmQwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI1NjYxNjgtYmIzYy00ZmUzLTllNjMtMzA3MDMwMDAxZmQwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home video trailer for the final season of this cop show"</script><metacontent="

Follows the lives and cases of a dirty Los Angeles Police Department cop and the unit under his command." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0286486/","name":"The Shield","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTcwNzQwODI5NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzQxMjI5MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows the lives and cases of a dirty Los Angeles Police Department cop and the unit under his command.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0286486/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"danielcereto","dateCreated":"2020-07-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Shield on 2020","reviewBody":"I just finished this series today on July 2020 and all I have to say is that it does not look cheap, old or non interesting, just keeping in mind this was filmed between 2002-2008. First, most of the main cast are extremely good actors. Vic, Aceveda and Shane were the most powerful. Second, the storyline and the length of the chapters are quite good too. Probably the story could have been told with 4-5 seasons easily. But it is what it is. Last, camera work, make up and sound are pretty cool. I can't believe this show started on 2002. On the other hand, seems some characters were not fully developed or look like the writers didn't want to give them credit. But not a big thing. So, overall if you're looking for an excellent cops show, brutal, raw and almost perfect, this one is for you. Now, I'm going to watch The Wire. I want to compare both shows and see which one is better.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":77198,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.7,"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2002-03-12","keywords":"corrupt cop,los angeles california,made for cable tv,mayor,drugs","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004821/","name":"Michael Chiklis","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0413052/","name":"Michael Jace","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0439813/","name":"Jay Karnes"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0086397/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0203234/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056447/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0752841/","name":"Shawn Ryan"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Shield: Season Seven","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi425591577","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI1NjYxNjgtYmIzYy00ZmUzLTllNjMtMzA3MDMwMDAxZmQwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI1NjYxNjgtYmIzYy00ZmUzLTllNjMtMzA3MDMwMDAxZmQwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home video trailer for the final season of this cop show"</script><metacontent="
